intro: Calyptranthes densa, commonly known as the dense calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
